info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 1:50AM EDT until August 23 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways.
* WHERE...Coastal New Hanover County.
* WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, from 6 AM EDT this morning through this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM to 10 AM EDT this morning.
* IMPACTS...Low-lying locations along the Intracoastal Waterway and adjacent tidal creeks may observe minor coastal flooding. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING
